availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Milton G. Thompson (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, tinsmith and coppersmith.)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, tinsmith and coppersmith. Pulaski County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Foreman Thompson in Fayette County, Kentucky, on February 10, 1857. Father of Harry Thompson and Mary Thompson. Tinsmith in Fayette County in 1850. Coppersmith in Lexington in 1860. Tinsmith in Fayette County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 4, p. 521.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 2, p. 233B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Fayette County, KY, July 1863, p. 58.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Fayette County Marriages, Film 007897103.
"M. G. Thompson A Victim of Heart Disease," The Lexington Herald (Lexington, KY), September 4, 1904, p. 8.
"SUDDEN," The Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), September 4, 1904, p. 3.
"Milton G. Thompson (1828-1904)," Find A Grave, Memorial 46830261, accessed September 3, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/46830261.
